characterInfo.Appears in: Words of Radiance, Oathbringer, Rhythm of War

characterDescription:
Glys is the spren with which Renarin Kholin has bonded that affords him the Surgebinding abilities of a Truthwatcher. Their bond grants him the Surges of Progression and Illumination.
According to Jasnah, Glys is one of the Voidspren. However, Glys has actually been corrupted by Sja-anat.
Glys is better known as a mistspren.

characterDetails.Appearance:
As a spren, Glys is bright red and crystalline, shimmering and dripping light upwards. Other Truthwatcherspren typically appear as light reflected through crystal on a surface. Glys's differing appearance is likely due to Sja-anat's corruption, and he prefers to stay invisible.
As a Shardblade, Glys is long, glowing, and thin, with barely a crossguard. The Blade has waving folds within it as if forged.
characterDetails.History: When Renarin tells his brother that in creating a Radiant Blade it just happened, he says that Glys wasn't certain he could do it, but that they needed more people to work the Oathgate ... so it happened.
characterDetails.Characteristics:
Although Rock has the ability to see all spren, he has never been able to spot Glys. He bows when Renarin isn't looking, just in case, and makes a sign of reverence to the hidden god.
Mistspren can each choose their own forms, and usually choose a shape like a person, but don't need to. Their free-form shape seems to Shallan like it would be difficult to capture in a sketch. Like steam, somehow trapped into a humanoid shape, contained by clothing and a strange mask.
characterDetails.Speculation: It's possible that Glys is that mistspren that Sja-anat refers to as her son.
characterDetails.Trivia: Glys is this mistspren's full name. It's not an abbreviated name.
